TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit StatusBar extends System.Windows.Forms.Control

Docs.summary: Represents a Windows status bar control. Although replaces and adds functionality to the control of previous versions, is retained for both backward compatibility and future use if you choose.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Typically, a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control consists of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> objects, each of which displays text and/or an icon. You can also provide owner-drawn panels to provide custom panels such as a progress bar or a series of images that displays the state of your application. A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control typically displays information about an object being viewed on a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>, the object's components, or contextual information that relates to that object's operation within your application.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control provides properties that enable you to customize the appearance of the control. If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> is displayed on a form that can be resized, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.SizingGrip%2A> property to display a sizing grip in the lower-right corner of the form to indicate to users that the form can be resized. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.ShowPanels%2A> property enables you to display panels within your <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> or to display only the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Text%2A> property of the control.
The default <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> has no panels. To add panels to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Add%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection> class that is accessible through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.Panels%2A> property of the control. You can also use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection> object provided through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.Panels%2A> property to remove panels from the control and access a specific <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> to manipulate the panel.
If you want to determine when a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> object within a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control is clicked, you can create an event handler for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.PanelClick> event. To perform owner-draw operations on a panel, you can create an event handler for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.DrawItem> event. The event data passed to the event handler provides information on the panel to draw and a <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object to use to perform drawing tasks.
When you create an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar>, the read/write properties are set to initial values. For a list of these values, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
## Examples The following code example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control on a form and adds two <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> objects. One of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> objects, named `panel1`, displays status text for an application. The second <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel>, named `panel2`, displays the current date and uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.ToolTipText%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> class to display the current time. The example uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.ShowPanels%2A> property to ensure that the panels are displayed instead of a standard panel, and it uses and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.Panels%2A> property to access the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Add%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection> to add the panels to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar>. The example also uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.AutoSize%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.BorderStyle%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.ToolTipText%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.Text%2A> properties to initialize the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> objects. This example requires that the method defined in the example is defined and called from the constructor of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>.
[!code-cpp[StatusBar and StatusBarPanel Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/StatusBar and StatusBarPanel Example/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[StatusBar and StatusBarPanel Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/StatusBar and StatusBarPanel Example/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[StatusBar and StatusBarPanel Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/StatusBar and StatusBarPanel Example/VB/form1.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> has no panels.
When you create an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar>, the following read/write properties are set to initial values.
|Property|Initial value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Dock%2A>|<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DockStyle.Bottom>| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.ShowPanels%2A>|`false`| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.SizingGrip%2A>|`true`|
You can change the value for any of these properties through a separate call to the property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to construct a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> and use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.SizingGrip%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.Alignment%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.Width%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.AutoSize%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.BorderStyle%2A?displayProperty=fullName> members and how to handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.PanelClick> event.
To run the example, paste the following code in a form. Call the `InitializeStatusBarPanels` method in the form's constructor or `Load` method.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample/VB/form1.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Disposes of the resources (other than memory) used by the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called by the public `Dispose` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method. `Dispose` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> references. This method invokes the `Dispose` method of each referenced object.

block.para:
can be called multiple times by other objects. When overriding , be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed of in an earlier call to . For more information about how to implement , see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
For more information about and , see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Overriding the Finalize Method](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/8026cb68-fe93-43fc-96c1-c09ad7d64cd3).

remarks.format: ## Remarks Setting this property has no effect on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control, therefore it is not shown in the designer or by IntelliSense.

Docs.summary: Occurs when a visual aspect of an owner-drawn status bar control changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use this event to perform drawing operations in an owner-drawn <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control. For example, if you display an owner-drawn <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> that displays a progress bar, you can use this event to perform the drawing of the progress bar on the panel. The data provided to the event through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarDrawItemEventArgs> object passed as a parameter to the event handler enables you to determine the panel that needs to be drawn and the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> to use to draw to the panel. This event is only raised when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.Style%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelStyle.OwnerDraw>.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create an owner-drawn <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> that displays a custom background and the current date. This example requires that you have connected the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.DrawItem> event of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control to the event handler defined in the example.
[!code-cpp[StatusBar.DrawItem#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/StatusBar.DrawItem/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[StatusBar.DrawItem#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/StatusBar.DrawItem/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[StatusBar.DrawItem#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/StatusBar.DrawItem/VB/form1.vb#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.OnDrawItem%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create an owner-drawn <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> that displays a custom background and the current date. This example requires that you have connected the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.DrawItem> event of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control to the event handler defined in the example.
[!code-cpp[StatusBar.DrawItem#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/StatusBar.DrawItem/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[StatusBar.DrawItem#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/StatusBar.DrawItem/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[StatusBar.DrawItem#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/StatusBar.DrawItem/VB/form1.vb#1)]

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's method so that registered delegates receive the event.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the control is redrawn.
Occurs when a object on a control is clicked.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use this event to perform tasks when a panel within a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control is clicked. The data provided to the event through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelClickEventArgs> passed as a parameter to the event handler enables you to determine the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> that was clicked by the user in order to perform tasks on the selected panel.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.SizingGrip%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.Alignment%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.Width%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.AutoSize%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.BorderStyle%2A?displayProperty=fullName> members and how to handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.PanelClick> event.
To run the example, paste the following code in a form. Call the `InitializeStatusBarPanels` method in the form's constructor or `Load` method.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample/VB/form1.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of panels contained within the control.
Docs.value: A containing the objects of the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control can display a number of panels to provide information to the user of your application. For example, a panel could display the current time or the progress of a file download. Each panel displayed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control is an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> class. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.Panels%2A> property enables you to obtain a reference to the collection of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> objects that are currently stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control. With this reference, you can add panels, remove panels, access a specific panel within the collection, and obtain a count of the panels in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control. For more information on the tasks that can be performed with the panel collection, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection> class reference topics.
## Examples The following code example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control on a form and adds two <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> objects. One of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> objects, named `panel1`, displays status text for an application. The second <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> object, named `panel2`, displays the current date and uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.ToolTipText%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> class to display the current time. The example uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.ShowPanels%2A> property to ensure that the panels are displayed instead of a standard panel, and it uses and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.Panels%2A> property to access the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Add%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection> to add the panels to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar>. The example also uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.AutoSize%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.BorderStyle%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.ToolTipText%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.Text%2A> properties to initialize the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> objects. This example requires that the method defined in the example is defined and called from the constructor of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>.
[!code-cpp[StatusBar and StatusBarPanel Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/StatusBar and StatusBarPanel Example/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[StatusBar and StatusBarPanel Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/StatusBar and StatusBarPanel Example/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[StatusBar and StatusBarPanel Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/StatusBar and StatusBarPanel Example/VB/form1.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether any panels that have been added to the control are displayed.
Docs.value: if panels are displayed; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control displays the value of its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Text%2A> property without any panels. When `ShowPanels` is set to `true`, any <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> objects specified in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control are displayed. No panels are initially created when you create an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> class. You can add panels to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Add%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection> class. This collection class can be accessed through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.Panels%2A> property of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar>.
## Examples The following code example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control on a form and adds two <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> objects. One of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> objects, named `panel1`, displays status text for an application. The second <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel>, named `panel2`, displays the current date and uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.ToolTipText%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> class to display the current time. The example uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.ShowPanels%2A> property to ensure that the panels are displayed instead of a standard panel, and it uses and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.Panels%2A> property to access the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Add%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection> to add the panels to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar>. The example also uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.AutoSize%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.BorderStyle%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.ToolTipText%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.Text%2A> properties to initialize the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> objects. This example requires that the method defined in the example is defined and called from the constructor of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>.
[!code-cpp[StatusBar and StatusBarPanel Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/StatusBar and StatusBarPanel Example/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[StatusBar and StatusBarPanel Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/StatusBar and StatusBarPanel Example/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[StatusBar and StatusBarPanel Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/StatusBar and StatusBarPanel Example/VB/form1.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a sizing grip is displayed in the lower-right corner of the control.
Docs.value: if a sizing grip is displayed; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use this property to display a sizing grip to provide an indication to the user when a form is resizable. If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.FormBorderStyle%2A> property of your <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> is set to a border style that is not resizable, such as<xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle.Fixed3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle.FixedDialog>, you should set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.SizingGrip%2A> property to `false` to prevent the user from thinking that the form can be resized.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.SizingGrip%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.Alignment%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.Width%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.AutoSize%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.BorderStyle%2A?displayProperty=fullName> members and how to handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.PanelClick> event.
To run the example, paste the following code in a form. Call the `InitializeStatusBarPanels` method in the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event handler.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample/VB/form1.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user will be able to tab to the .
Docs.value: if the tab key moves focus to the ; otherwise . The default is .

MemberSignature.Value: public override string Text { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text associated with the control.
Docs.value: The text associated with the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property represents the text displayed by the control.
> [!CAUTION] > The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control displays only the first 127 characters of a string.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.Text%2A> property. To run the example, paste the following code in a form. Call the `InitializeSimpleStatusBar` method in the form's constructor or `Load` method.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarDrawItemEventHandler#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarDrawItemEventHandler/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarDrawItemEventHandler#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarDrawItemEventHandler/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarDrawItemEventHandler#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarDrawItemEventHandler/VB/form1.vb#1)]
